task-wr.title: Provisioning Interfaces on a Compute Host Using the CLI
task-wr.shortdesc: You can use the controller-0 command-line interface to configure network interfaces on a host.

context.p: The details for attaching an interface depend on the network configuration (for example, whether shared interfaces are used). A simple example is provided here. For more information, see .

prereq.p: The Titanium Server software must be installed on the host.
To configure the data interfaces on a compute host, provider networks are required.

step.cmd: Ensure that provider networks are available for the data interfaces. For more information, see .

info.p: For example, to attach an interface named enp0s9 to a VLAN provider network named providernet-a, using Ethernet interface enp0s9 on compute-0:

codeblock.userinput: system host-if-modify -n enp0s9 \ -nt data compute-0 enp0s9 -p providernet-a

step.cmd: If the cluster uses an infrastructure network, provision an infrastructure interface.

info.p: For example, to attach a VLAN interface named infra0 with VLAN ID 22 to the infrastructure network, using Ethernet interface enp0s8 on storage-0:

codeblock.userinput: system host-if-add storage-0 -V 22 -nt infra infra0 vlan enp0s8
